sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition method: 

2x + 3y - z = 8 

x - 2y + 4z = -6 

3x + 4y - 5z = -3
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using the QR decomposition method, we first need to rewrite the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 2  3 -1 |
    | 1 -2  4 |
    | 3  4 -5 |

b = |  8  |
    | -6  |
    | -3  |

Now, we will perform QR decomposition on matrix A. QR decomposition is a method of decomposing a matrix A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R such that A = QR.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R.

1. Find the orthogonal basis for A:

u1 = a1 = (2, 1, 3)
e1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (2/√14, 1/√14, 3/√14)

u2 = a2 - proj(a2, e1)
   = (3, -2, 4) - ((3, -2, 4) · e1) * e1
   = (3, -2, 4) - (11/√14) * (2/√14, 1/√14, 3/√14)
   = (1/√14, -3/√14, 1/√14)
e2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (1/3, -1, 1/3)

u3 = a3 - proj(a3, e1) - proj(a3, e2)
   = (-1, 4, -5) - ((-1, 4, -5) · e1) * e1 - ((-1, 4, -5) · e2) * e2
   = (-1, 4, -5) - (-1/√14) * (2/√14, 1/√14, 3/√14) - (1) * (1/3, -1, 1/3)
   = (0, 0, -2)
e3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (0, 0, -1)

2. Form the orthogonal matrix Q and upper triangular matrix R:

Q = |  2/√14  1/3  0 |
    |  1/√14 -1   0 |
    |  3/√14  1/3 -1 |

R = | √14  11/√14 -1/√14 |
    |  0    3      1    |
    |  0    0      2    |

Now, we can solve the system Rx = Q^T * b:

Q^T * b = |  2/√14  1/√14  3/√14 | |  8  |   |  2√14  |
          |  1/3    -1    1/3   | | -6  | = |   0    |
          |  0       0    -1    | | -3  |   |   6    |

Now, we can solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^T * b:

| √14  11/√14 -1/√14 | | x |   |  2√14  |
|  0    3      1    | | y | = |   0    |
|  0    0      2    | | z |   |   6    |

Solving the system, we get:

z = 6 / 2 = 3
y = (0 - 1 * z) / 3 = -1
x = (2√14 - 11/√14 * y + 1/√14 * z) / √14 = 2

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 2, y = -1, and z = 3.
